column2: Acceptance criteria - Submitted at least 20 working days prior to submission of ROL’s if required.
Acceptance criteria - If not previously submitted as part of the TMP or where a TMP is not required, submitted at least 3 working days prior to its proposed use.
Acceptance criteria - Submitted at least ten (10) days prior to commencement of works.
Acceptance criteria - Survey work is performed by qualified surveyor using appropriate surveying equipment to determine extent of the site.
Acceptance criteria - Conformance of Characteristics as per tables 3252.1 and 3253.1
• Sample to be taken for each load at delivery point
Acceptance criteria - Bitumen not to be heated above the manufacturer’s recommendations
2.2 Aggregate Precoating Agent & Bitumen Adhesion Agent
Acceptance criteria - Aggregate precoating agents must conform to Specification TfNSW 3268 for the grade of polymer modified binder specified in Annexure R107/A.
Acceptance criteria - Bitumen adhesion agents must conform to Specification TfNSW 3269 for the grade of polymer modified binder specified in Annexure R107/A.
2.3 Oils for Reducing the Viscosity of Bitumen
2.3.1 - Oils for Reducing the Viscosity of Bitumen
Acceptance criteria - The oils for reducing the viscosity of bitumen must conform to AS 3568.
Acceptance criteria - The supply and delivery of aggregate must meet the requirements of Specification TfNSW 3151.
• Test results for each site of aggregate must be obtained before use in the Works.
• If requested, a sample from the same site must be provided to the Principal.
• The sample size must follow AS 1141.3.
Acceptance criteria - Arrange and manage aggregate stockpiles in accordance with the following requirements:
• The maximum Site size for aggregate stockpiles is 250 m3.
• Stockpiles must be placed on firm level ground and separated from other stockpiles to prevent cross-contamination.
• The quantity and type of each stockpile must be clearly labeled.
• Recovery from stockpiles must minimize segregation and contamination.
Acceptance criteria - Nonwoven needle punched fabric.
3.0 Nominated Materials and Design of Bituminous Surfacing
Acceptance criteria - Measure surface texture – Test Method T240

Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Five (5) measurements every 250 metres and at changes in aggregate size or heavy patches (shoulder, wheel paths, between wheel paths and centre line) per lane of sprayed bituminous surfacing works)
Acceptance criteria - Nominated application rates using T240 results and nominated materials.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Bitumen application rate in L/m², Aggregate spread rate in m²/m³
Bitumen Adhesion Agent || Prime/Primer seal || 1 % maximum
Bitumen Adhesion Agent || Seal/Reseal || 0.5 - 1.0 % depending on the results of initial adhesion and stripping tests or anticipated weather
Cutter Oil || Prime/Primer seal || as per design
Cutter Oil || Seal/Reseal || as per TfNSW Form 382
Flux Oil || Seal/Reseal || Subject to the Principal's approval of your proposal, you may use up to 4%
3.4 - Submission Materials and Spray Seal Design
Ref docs - TfNSW R106 CL. 3.3/R107 Cl. 3.2
Acceptance criteria - Submission of Nominated design, T240 surface texture recordings, nominated materials and conformance certificates
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Constituent material:
• Cutter oil (7 days prior to works being carried out)
Ref docs - TfNSW R106 CL. 3.4/R107 Cl. 3.3
Acceptance criteria - Review design at each location based on actual ALD test result for the actual aggregate to be used instead of the ALD of the nominated material.
Acceptance criteria - Materials are sampled and tested according to relevant specifications in Clause 2 and AS 2008. Testing complies with Annexure R107/L.
Acceptance criteria - provide a uniform application of binder with adequate adhesion to the underlying surface.
• provide a complete cover of interlocking aggregate particles.
• achieve effective bond between binder and aggregate.
Acceptance criteria - Use process control chart for work where 10 or more sprayer runs greater than 1,000 litres are required per shift.
• Take corrective action where conformance criteria is not met.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - ≥ 2% and ≤5% over 5 successive runs
5.0 Condition for Commencement of Sprayed Bituminous Surfacing Works
Acceptance criteria - Aggregate supplied with a light, uniform coverage of all particles. Store to avoid contamination– Clean and dry.
• Stockpile the material at the site, the maximum site size must not exceed 250 cubic metres
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Cover aggregate if rain is imminent
Acceptance criteria - Loose or damaged material is removed.
• Neat edges on the transition area.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - Pavement surface to be swept by use of rotary road broom, suction broom and stiff bass hand broom (if needed).
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Sweeping must extend a least 300mm beyond each edge.
Acceptance criteria - Surface Level picked up by qualified surveyor.
Acceptance criteria - Measure and record pavement temperatures at regular intervals during the course of work.
• Where spray sealing is delayed and significant rain events have since occurred, undertake moisture testing to ensure the base has achieved sufficient dry back.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - If pavement is in shade and sun take both measurements.
• Do not spray wet pavement or when rain is imminent
• Do not spray during strong winds or dust storm.
5.6 - Protection of services and road fixtures
Acceptance criteria - Protect road fixtures, (gratings, hydrants, valve boxes, hydrants, manhole covers, bridge or culvert decks etc.
• Remove adherent patches of foreign material from the surface of the pavement. Mask or remove raised pavement markers.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - TRPMs shall be the same colour as the colour of the RRPMs. For example, they should be:
• TRPMs should simulate the normal RRPM pattern for the respective pavement markings
Acceptance criteria - Certification and operation of sprayer
• Sufficient loaded and measured trucks of dry aggregate to provide full cover for the area sprayed and a uniform finish.
• Rollers – dual axle smooth pneumatic tyred multi-wheel with mass greater than seven (7) tonnes without ballast and minimum tyre pressure of 550kPa.
Acceptance criteria - Protect all fixtures using paper (or other appropriate barrier material)
• Check the quantity of binder sprayed against the area covered and make necessary adjustments.
• 50 mm overlap spray between adjacent longitudinal for special type end nozzles or intermediate nozzles set with a jig.
• normal manner for intermediate nozzles and the overlap must be at least 300 mm.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Dip after each run
• Within ±5% of target design application rate for conventional and PMB bitumen’s
Acceptance criteria - Application of binder over primer as per design application rate.
• Limit area to be sprayed to ensure coverage of aggregate at the target application rated and initially rolled within;
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Keep all traffic off primed surface
Acceptance criteria - Only precoated aggregate should be used.
• The aggregate must be of the specified size and applied at the target rate. The actual spread rate must be determined using TfNSW T274 or an approved method and reported using TfNSW Form 500E.
• The aggregate must be spread uniformly using suitable equipment and any bare or insufficiently covered areas must be re-run or covered by hand to achieve uniform coverage at the target rate.

• Initial rolling must be carried out using two or more dual axle smooth pneumatic tyred multi-wheel rollers with a minimum load of one tonne per tyre and minimum tyre pressure of 550 kPa until aggregate is firmly embedded in the binder.

• Rolling must continue with at least eight passes within one hour of spraying at every point on the surface. Sufficient rollers must be on site to complete the specified minimum amount of rolling as a continuous operation with successive spray runs.

Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Aggregate application must begin within five minutes of spraying the binder and be completed and initially rolled within that time.
• Aggregate containing surface moisture or free surface water should not be used.
• If the aggregate is not evenly distributed, a light drag broom may be used after initial rolling. If the broom dislodges aggregate particles, drag brooming should be deferred or eliminated.
9.0 Sweeping and Loose Aggregate Removal (10mm and 14mm Seal / Reseals only)
9.1 - Final sweeping and loose aggregate measurement prior to opening to traffic.
Acceptance criteria - All loose material removed.
• Measure loose aggregate particles – RMS Test method T277.
• Other medium to high traffic (250 v/l/d): 30 particles / m²
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) - Temporary 60 km/h speed zoning must be in place until the maximum allowable loose aggregate requirement is met.
